Data Analyst

description:
At Popular, we offer a wide variety of services and financial solutions to serve our communities in the Island and abroad. As employees, we are dedicated to making our customers dreams come true by offering financial solutions in each stage of their life. Our extensive trajectory demonstrates the resiliency and determination of our employees to innovate, reach for the right solutions and strongly support the communities we serve; this is why we value their diverse skills, experiences and backgrounds.

Are you ready for a rewarding career?
Over 7,900 men and women in Puerto Rico, Virgin Islands and the United States work at Popular.
Come and join our community!
Full Time Opportunity
General Description
The Data Analyst designs and executes data mining plans, performs primary and secondary analyses, prepares reports, and conducts research & presentations of moderate difficulty on a wide range of projects. Tasks typically involve quantitative analysis, data integration from both internal & external sources and database development. It also involves market research project coordination.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Performs data mining and analyze large sets of data to identify patterns and trends by applying quantitative and analytical tools. Ensures data quality by performing segmentation, applicable policies, and accuracy audits.
Pinpoints trends, correlations, and patterns in complicated data sets.
Regularly review and assess condition of retail lending portfolios and develop and implement credit policies and monitoring procedures to maintain credit risk exposure within acceptable parameters.
Monitor and assess the post-implementation impact of risk management strategies.
Identifies methods and procedures for obtaining, maintaining, and updating customer related data, including the collection, coding, and tabulation. Leads the evaluation of the data as well as the database development and maintenance or relational database and data system.
Uses statistical methods to analyze data and generate useful reports. For example, customer profiles and response analyses.
Develops analysis and recurrent reports for management and internal clients, presenting the results of research and analysis. Provides concise data reports and clear data visualizations for management.
Helps facilitate processes to translate data insights into strategic direction.
Supports integration of credit risk models previously developed into database process and analyses.
Make recommendations of credit policies adjustments and portfolio management strategies based on the results of the analysis made.
Works with management and staff to ensure understanding and implementation of applicable policies/guidelines, automation systems and procedures.
Maintain consistent open communication and develop strong relationships with credit underwriting units.
Manages projects as assigned.
Performs related duties and responsibilities required.
Education
Bachelor’s degree (B.A.) in Industrial Engineering, Computer Science or Economics, Statistics or Mathematics
Experience
Two (2) years of experience in data mining, research, market analysis and/or data management, financial analysis or other related fields.
Other Qualifications
Knowledge of and ability to design database analyses.
Knowledge of and ability to perform quantitative analysis.
Working knowledge of data management, including database and spreadsheet applications, with the ability to use moderately complex models or specialized computer applications.
Advanced statistical analysis skills. Specifically, ability to apply advanced analysis methodologies, interpret and present findings in a clear, concise manner, including the creation and use of tables, charts and graphics to summarize results.
Proficient in statistical programs like SAS, SPSS, R and / or data processing tools like SQL, Power Pivot, FoxPro and Cognos. (preferable)
Ability to evaluate design, analysis and conclusions based on database information.
Ability to prepare clear and comprehensive reports.
Ability to make sound decisions in a consistent manner with essential job functions.
Excellent oral and communication skills, both in English and Spanish.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
Certifications on Data Science, Analytics and/or Data Management is a plus

title:
Xtillion: Data Science Associate
- job post
description:
Are you looking to join a fast-paced team at the forefront of the technology services industry? Xtillion is a high-growth technology services firm based in San Juan, PR. The company seeks to capitalize on the booming Big Data and AI markets by helping enterprise clients optimize and secure their data infrastructure and turn data into a strategic advantage through next-gen analytics and AI tools. The company has an aggressive growth strategy, looking to expand across various industries within the United States. Xtillion is committed to attracting, developing, and retaining exceptional talent by offering a unique opportunity for growth for suitable candidates.
Data Science Associate
As a Data Science Associate, your role will encompass a diverse range of responsibilities. You will collect, clean, and analyze large volumes of data. Utilizing statistical techniques, machine learning algorithms, and predictive modeling, you will extract valuable insights and patterns from the data to support business decision-making. As a Data Science Associate, your contributions will play a vital role in shaping business strategies and driving innovation within the organization and our clients.
Responsibilities include:
Use advanced machine learning, statistical modeling and optimization techniques to build real-world solutions for online and offline decision-making.
Autonomously own data science client projects from start to finish with limited guidance
Develop and implement data-driven solutions for clients, create visualizations to communicate findings, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to address client needs.
Collect and mine data from disparate data sources, digging deeper to understand the process behind the data.
Communicate effectively with business leaders and clients on project status, timeline and technical results.
Translate business opportunities into data science problems, clearly defining project scope + performance metrics to measure success.
Contribute to the continuous improvement of data science methodologies, staying up-to-date with industry trends and best practices.
We're tight-knit, fast-paced and even faster-growing teams working with a large amount of complex data. In this role, you'll identify new growth opportunities, build powerful visualizations and unearth actionable insights.
What we are looking for:

General:
Bachelor's degree in statistics, applied mathematics, or related discipline
Fully bilingual in English and Spanish with excellent communication skills.
Proactive, positive attitude, well-organized, and adept at managing competing deadlines and priorities.
Highly motivated, strong desire to learn and grow with the company, and possess a positive, energetic attitude.
Comfortable in a fast-paced and changing environment, wanting to learn new skills.
Strong communication skills to effectively collaborate with clients and team members.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently as well as part of a team.
A passion for learning and staying updated with the latest technologies and industry trends.
Technical:
Some experience solving complex problems through the use of predictive modeling.
Experience in querying and processing data from complex relational databases.
Training and knowledge in machine learning, statistical modeling and/or optimization.
Demonstrated ability to synthesize data into actionable insights and communicate recommendations to clients and leadership.
Proficiency with data mining, mathematics, and statistical analysis.
Pattern recognition and predictive modeling is a plus
Experience with Excel, SQL, and programming languages (ex: Java/Python, SAS)
Ability to work effectively in a dynamic, research-oriented group that has several concurrent projects
We offer competitive salaries and a comprehensive benefits program for full-time employees, including medical, dental and vision coverage, paid time off and 401(k) plan.
